values:
Okay, Lys1123, your answers to the survey you posted were interesting.  Let's see what I come up with.

1) The singular boring question: What is your name?  Your Highness will do.  Otherwise, it's M'Chelle 
What is your Quest?  To crusade against resteraunts for selling tea at $1.50 a pop when I can buy a whole box for $3 bucks.
What is your favorite Color?  
Purple and blue

(2) If you had been born a member of the opposite sex, what would your name have been? 
Adam, I think

(3) Would you name a child of yours after you?
Not my actual name, but probably give it a funny spelling.  Helps build character.

(4) If you had to switch first names with a friend of yours, who would you switch with?
My husband's cousin Tara, because I love that name.

(5) What's the way people most often mispronounce any part of your name?
People usually don't mispronounce it.  They don't say it at all because they get stumped by the spelling.  They usually pronounce my first name, Apryle (pronounced like the month), as Aprilay.  One telemarketer called it Arilay for some reason.

(6) If you were to become famous, would you drop your last name (like Madonna, Cher, Roseanne)?
Yeah.  Smith is pretty common.

(7) Do you believe in the traditional view of Heaven and Hell?
I believe in the Christian view, but expanded.

(8) Do you think God has a gender? 
Both

(9) Do you think science counteracts religion?
Couldn't tell ya.  Never really was into Science.

(10) Do you believe in organized religion?
As long as the organized religion doesn't cram it's philisophy down the throats of other organized religions.

(11) Where do you think we go when we die?
Second star to the right and straight on till morning.

(12) Do you feel a little funny thinking about the questions in this section?
Should I?

(13) How easy is it to make you laugh?
Normally too easy.

(14) What person you know makes you laugh the most? 
Probably my brother.  He can have me dying with laughter one second and wanting to brain him the next.  Never could understand that.
 
15) Do you laugh at jokes you know you shouldn't?
Depends on what someone thinks I shouldn't laugh at.

(16) Do you tell jokes you know you shouldn't?
Depends on who I'm telling it to.  Different jokes for different folks.

(17) What words instantly make you laugh or at least smile?
Jellybeans.  Long story.

(18) What do you think is the funniest thing you've ever said or written? 
I can't remember that!  I've slept since then!

(19) Do you ever dance to music when nobody's watching? 
Yep!

(20) What is/are the worst song(s) you have ever heard?
That stupid "I'm too sexy for my car, cat, dog, clothes, and whatever he's too sexy for" song by Right Said Fred or someone equally dumb.

(21) What song(s) do you wish you could understand a little better?
None that I can think of.  Normally if I can't understand it I'm listening because the music itself caught my attention and I'm not really listening to the words.

(22) What song(s) are constantly in your head?
Usually depends on what I heard coming to work.  This morning it was Loreena McKinnett's "Lady of Shallott"

(23) What song(s) do you think describe your personality best?
Too many to list.  

(24) If you were to serenade the object of your affections, which song(s) would you use?
"But When He Shines" by Sheena Easton.  Describes my husband to a T.

(25) If the object of your affections were to serenade you, what song(s) would you hope he or she used? 
"Amazed" by Lonestar

(26) What movie(s) do you love that nobody else seems to?
Normally Star Trek movies, but then some other Trekker pops up out of the woodwork, so that's not a good example.

(27) Do you agree with the idea that sequels are always worse than the original? 
Nope

(28) Who's your favorite Star Wars character?
Jar Jar Binks and R2D2.  They're unsung heroes.

(29) What kind of movie do you think there should be more of?
Sci-Fi and Fantasy.  Always.  They seem to come out in clumps every few years, and then nothing.  And more comedies that are actually funny.

(30) What movie(s) do you simply not understand the appeal of?
Toooooo many to list.

(31) When eating, are you more concerned with taste or healthiness? 
Both

(32) What's your favorite kind of cheese? 
Cheddar.  Tons of it.

(33) What do you think your answer to the previous question reveals about your personality? 
That I was a mouse in a past life.  How the hell should I know?

(34) If you knew exactly what went into Chinese food, hamburger meat, etc., would you still eat it? 
Somethings I just don't need to know.  EVER!  So don't tell me!

(35) Do you ever feel guilty eating meat?
Nope.

(36) Mac or PC?
Huh?

(37) How much do you actually care about the inner workings of your computer, as long as it works?
Not a damn bit.  Again, some things I don't want to know.

(38) Do you ever begin preferring IMs to other forms of conversation?
No.  It's annoying.  I never even liked talking on the telephone as a teenager.

(39) Do you find you're different talking through Probably more outspoken.

(40) Have you ever ended bid on something on eBay and regretted it later?
No, just maybe regretted spending the money.  Practical side kicking me in the head.

(41) Have you ever wished you could experience being the other gender? 
Only if it would make me understand what the male fear of talking and the clothes hamper is.

(42) What do you love most about the other gender?
Mowing the lawn and changing the oil.

(43) What do you dislike most about the other gender?
An ingrained inability to feel compassion for anything.

(44) What do you understand least about the other gender? 
Where their fear of talking and the clothes hamper comes from.

(45) Do you sometimes see a movie or watch a show just because a good-looking celebrity is in it?
"Angel" and "Hercules".  Enough said.

(46) What celebrity's autograph do you want most? 
Not really crazy about autographs I have to pay for, but that is just my opinion.  Would pay for Leonard Nimoy's and Nichelle Nichols though.

(47) Have people ever said you looked like a celebrity, and if so, who?
No, but I like to think of myself as Anna Nicole Smith with a vertical disadvantage.

(48) If there was to be a movie about you, who do you think should play you (in personality, looks or both)? 
Kathy Bates.  Much older, but I just love her.

(49) Does it ever annoy you when you know someone is a celebrity but you can't remember why?
No. It annoys me when I see a celebrity on a show and can't remember what else I've seen them in.

(50) If you could enter any celebrity's mind like in "Being John Malkovich", whose would you enter? 
Cher.  Her whole attitude is awesome.  And Madonna.

(51) Do you want to be John Malkovich?
No.

(52) Do you laugh when you hear or read the number 69? 
Hold on, let me find out....hmmmm, nope.

(53) Were you lying about your answer to the previous question?
Hmmmmm, nope.

(54) Do you actually know your Social Security Number?
Yes, by heart, but I can never remember my driver's license number.

(55) Do you actually know your IP address?
Nope.

(56) Do you know what an IP address is?
Idiot Person?

(57) Do you know the four-character extension on your ZIP code?
Do I need to?

(58) Ever thought there were too many numbers floating around in our lives?
Don't you?!

(59) Does your head begin to hurt when you think of infinity, imaginary numbers, irrational numbers, etc.? 
I try not to think of infinity, imaginary numbers, irrational number, etc.

Someone was seriously bored when they came up with this survey.

Bye now!
BA

AAARRRGGGHHH!  I can't believe how irritating people can be sometimes.  Go into a meeting, and they just love nothing better than to find some way to run someone else down and make themselves look better.  Like the whole blessed world revolves around their opinion, and no one else's opinion is worth anything.  I just hate how conceited and self-centered people can be.  I guess no one has heard the term DIPLOMACY!!  Guess not, or we wouldn't have so many wars in the world.  Why can't people just treat each other right?  Try it sometime, people.  You might like it!

Okay, I'm going to go away now and try not to blow my stack.

Bonnieangel

Hmmmm....where do I start?  Exactly what do you write about in a journal that can be seen by GOD and everybody?  Leaves the sex life out, I guess, unless your into voyeurism.  Maybe I will have a better idea about it tomorrow.

Saw Pearl Harbor on Saturday.  Boy, am I a sap!  I almost cried at on at least 3 different occasions in that movie.  Really am a romantic at heart, I guess.  Most Libras are.  In love with love, that's us!  I don't much care for laundry, dishes, and housework, but love is alright.  

Okay, rambling now.  Better sign off before I sound really bizarre.

Bonnieangel
